Abandoned by the Metropolitan Opera Cowpany, whrch gave ts 1966-67 season in its new home in the Lincoln Center of Performung Arts, New Iork's old Metropolrtan Opera House now 1s being deaaolIshed to make room for a 10-story offuce tower. ho new building was designed by the Offces of Irwin S. Chanin, Architect, which over the years has given the city, and the Muddle Atlantic Coast frow New England to Virginia, great offuce buildings, urban apartment houses, hotels, legitiwate and aotion picture theatres, suburban resdentlal communities, a great
shopping center and commercial and industrial buildings.
Erected in 1D6), the old Hetropolitan was the last survivor in a theatrical, opera and concert district, aostly located south of Lu2nd Street, which over the years has woved northward by a aile or aore with its spine, in general, still Broadway,
upon wnich the old Metropolitan faced.
The new building, to contain about l-udllion square feet of office and

rent will help aeet the operating defucit of the opera coapany.
